reg_info.act_under: Ontario Heritage Act   Loi sur le patrimoine de l’Ontario

content.content: 1. An application for a licence under section 48 of the Act shall be in Form 1. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 881, s. 1.
content.raw_html: 1. An application for a licence under section 48 of the Act shall be in Form 1. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 881, s. 1.

content.content: 2. A licence shall be in Form 2. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 881, s. 2.
content.raw_html: 2. A licence shall be in Form 2. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 881, s. 2.

content.content: 3. An archaeological site record shall be in Form 3. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 881, s. 3.
content.raw_html: 3. An archaeological site record shall be in Form 3. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 881, s. 3.

content.content: 4. An archaeological site record update form shall be in Form 4. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 881, s. 4.
content.raw_html: 4. An archaeological site record update form shall be in Form 4. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 881, s. 4.

content.content: 5. A report under section 65 of the Act shall be in Form 5. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 881, s. 5.
content.raw_html: 5. A report under section 65 of the Act shall be in Form 5. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 881, s. 5.

content.content: 6. It is a term and condition of a licence, (a) that the licensee keep in safekeeping all objects of archaeological significance that are found under the authority of the licence and all field records that are made in the course of the work authorized by the licence, except where the objects and records are donated to Her Majesty the Queen in right of Ontario or are directed to be deposited in a public institution under subsection 66 (1) of the Act; (b) that the licensee, when requested by the Minister, complete and submit to the Minister an archaeological site record or an archaeological site record update form, as the case may be; (c) that the licensee forthwith notify the Minister where there is a change in, (i) the purpose for which the licence was requested, (ii) the training and expertise of the applicant, (iii) the methods that the applicant proposes to use in carrying out the activities for which the licence was requested, and (iv) the financial and material resources of the applicant, as submitted in the application for the licence; and (d) that the licensee, when requested by the Minister, notify the Minister as to, (i) the proposed care of any objects or records at the conclusion of each season’s work, (ii) the time likely to be required to analyze and catalogue any objects found under the authority of the licence and any records, and (iii) the proposed long term use of any objects found under the authority of the licence or records after the conclusion of the work. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 881, s. 6. FORM 1   APPLICATION FOR AN ARCHAEOLOGICAL LICENCE Ontario Heritage Act     R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 881, Form 1. FORM 2 Ontario Heritage Act  R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 881, Form 2. FORM 3   ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITE RECORD Ontario Heritage Act   R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 881, Form 3. FORM 4   ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITE UPDATE Ontario Heritage Act   R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 881, Form 4. FORM 5 Ontario Heritage Act   R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 881, Form 5.
content.raw_html:
6. It is a term and condition of a licence,

(a) that the licensee keep in safekeeping all objects of archaeological significance that are found under the authority of the licence and all field records that are made in the course of the work authorized by the licence, except where the objects and records are donated to Her Majesty the Queen in right of Ontario or are directed to be deposited in a public institution under subsection 66 (1) of the Act;

(b) that the licensee, when requested by the Minister, complete and submit to the Minister an archaeological site record or an archaeological site record update form, as the case may be;

(c) that the licensee forthwith notify the Minister where there is a change in,

(i) the purpose for which the licence was requested,

(ii) the training and expertise of the applicant,

(iii) the methods that the applicant proposes to use in carrying out the activities for which the licence was requested, and

(iv) the financial and material resources of the applicant,

as submitted in the application for the licence; and

(d) that the licensee, when requested by the Minister, notify the Minister as to,

(i) the proposed care of any objects or records at the conclusion of each season’s work,

(ii) the time likely to be required to analyze and catalogue any objects found under the authority of the licence and any records, and

(iii) the proposed long term use of any objects found under the authority of the licence or records after the conclusion of the work. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 881, s. 6.
